intro: Euonymus lawsonii, commonly known as the Chinese lantern plant, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Asia. It features striking, orange-red蒴果 (capsules) that resemble small lanterns, which persist through winter. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are ovate to elliptic in shape. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant. Its unique fruiting structure and autumn color make it a notable species in botanical gardens and landscapes.
